page.title: 04CRAMOND :Primary School
page.content: The 280 children of Cramond Primary School are housed in two buildings which are a ten minute walk apart.The smaller and much older building, in Whitehouse Road, has four classrooms and accomodates three infant classes. This stone building was first used as a school in 1875.Prior to that it was two dwelling houses - a fact that is still fairly obvious from the front. The large,light-coloured modern building in Cramond Crescent which was completed in 1975 has 8 class- rooms,and two more are in a trans- portable hut. Apart from 12 class teachers there are part-time specialists in music,craft and remedial work. The school's large grassy play area is poorly drained and very muddy. Aircraft noise is something of a problem despite double glazing.
